item.title: Ghost of Yotei Game Size and Pre-Load Date Revealed
item.content:encoded:
Ghost of Yotei’s game size has been revealed, with less than a month to go before launch, and it comes in over 85 GB.

Sucker Punch’s next instalment to their Ghost series launches for the PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 5 Pro on October 2, 2025. Ahead of the launch, we have learned that the game has already gone gold. Now, new details have revealed the Ghost of Yotei’s file size as well as the pre-load date for the game.

Ghost of Yotei’s Game Size is 85 GB

The latest details about Ghost of Yotei’s file size come through an X post (formerly Twitter) from the reputed PlayStation Game Size account. Their new post states that the game’s download size is 85.119 GB for version 01.002.000. Interested players will be able to pre-load the game a week prior to its launch on September 25, 2025. The release time for the game is set for midnight. It is also a substantial increase of Ghost of Tsushima’s Director’s Cut, which came in at 60 GB, including the Iki Island expansion.

Ahead of the launch, the developers have been showcasing the many types of weapons players will be able to use in the upcoming title. Most recently, we saw the Odachi in action, a more extended version of the katana that can help reduce the distance between you and the enemy. The Odachi might not be as quick as the katana, but it can inflict devastating blows as Atsu slices and dices her enemies.

Prior to that, we witnessed Ghost of Yotei’s firearms combat; some of these can kill enemies in a single blow. Also, here’s the game’s trailer for Gamescom’s Opening Night Live. What are your thoughts on Ghost of Yotei’s game size being 85 GB? Will you be pre-loading the title? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1540: Hints And Answer For September 6, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Every day, Wordle presents a new five-letter word for players to guess in six attempts or less. If you want to improve your chances of solving it, today’s hints and strategies can give you an edge—provided you don’t mind a bit of guidance. If you’ve found yourself struggling with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful tips and even the answer for Wordle Game #1540 for September 6, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you just want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information will include spoilers on today’s, and yesterday’s, edition of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players get six attempts to guess the five-letter word answer. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a trending topic online.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There currently isn’t an app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, September 6, 2025

Today’s Wordle is one that seems to be a tougher guess than most. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.6 guesses out of 6 to get. That’s up from September 5’s 3.6 average.

General Wordle Hints For September 6

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: Today’s Wordle answer starts with the letter “B”
  • Hint 2: The Wordle answer has two vowels
  • Hint 3: One definition for Friday’s answer is “a rounded swelling”
  • Hint 5: There are no repeating letters in today’s Wordle word, so focus on unique letters in your first guesses.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1540 for September 6, 2025

Starter Words For September 6, 2025

If you just want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer handed to you, there are a few starter words worth trying. A couple starter words that may help are:

  • BEACH
  • GUIDE

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1540 On September 6, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including looking at the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: BULGE

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed yesterday’s game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1539 on September 5, 2025:

Answer: DRIFT

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The next game will be Wordle Game #1541.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily online word puzzle created by Josh Wardle, who first created the game as a prototype in 2013 and released it in 2021. It challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six attempts or fewer, using clues from previous guesses. The game became a viral hit in late 2021 due to its simplicity, shareable results, and the excitement of solving a new puzzle every day. Wordle has even inspired countless spin-offs and daily challenges across social media.

item.title: Metal Gear Solid Delta Snake Eater Sold Over 1 Million Copies in 2 Days
item.content:encoded:
Metal Gear Solid Delta Snaker Eater sold more than 1 million copies by August 28, 2025.

The remake players have been waiting for years has finally been released, and the fans have been showering it with all the love they can. The game was released on August 26, and by August 28, Metal Gear Solid: Snake Eater had already sold over 1 million units. The number may have increased by now.

A couple of hours after announcing that MGS 3 Remake sold 1 million copies by August 28, 2025, the developers released a new update, ver. 1.1.3. The update is now available for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S and should be available for Steam soon. Players receive a brand-new feature, the Inverted Camera Look (Horizontal) feature, which can be found in the Options menu under Controls. There are also some fixes, which you can check out below.

  • An issue where players might not receive the reward for collecting all GA-KO has been fixed.
  • The models and textures for certain scenes have been updated.
  • Most game crash issues have been resolved after investigating the received reports.
  • Minor bug fixes and adjustments have been made.

The developers have acknowledged the feedback and issue reports players are sharing and are actively investigating them. At the moment, they are working on the following items:

  • 21:9 aspect ratio display support on Steam.
  • An in-game feature to check system specifications on Steam.
  • An option to select a preferred rendering mode when playing on PlayStation 5 Pro.
  • Improvements to overall performance stability for all platforms

In other news, Konami has addressed the launch issues of Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater. Also, Hideo Kojima has hinted that Metal Gear Solid 5: Phantom Pain was ‘unfinished‘.
